documents.document: @LaQuishaStR That is literally 100% better than my post-apocalyptic skill, which is 'furrowing my brow nervously and retweeting.'
Whoa https://t.co/Q9HIGp9t2l
@gingerest Roger that!
7 am on Monday morning here is NZ and I'm unironically wishing for last week's deep concerns re: t's financial conflicts of interest.
@Little_Red_Boat @jpbrammer It's on us to keep track--I just feel so overwhelmed. Haven't been able to leave message w/ Rubio for a week.
WHO DO I CALL re: Bannon in a national security role?
@marcorubio I have been trying to leave a message at two of your offices for seven days now--why are the voice mails always full?
@annehelen Or to make out on the Peter Pan ride at Disneywod at 'Night Of Joy.'
Me all day every day. https://t.co/kuoYHLLuxL
@kaupapa More than I can adequately express, and I didn't even vote for him.
Time away from social media isn't helping. Embroidery, cooking, being w/friends isn't helping.
From whom do I demand that the press sec use truth and logic and actual facts.
It doesn't feel like giving $ and calling my reps every day is working, at all. Senate won't stop gag rule or DAPL.
The other constantly running loop is 'you're so lucky to be here you're so lucky to be here' and attendant guilt
I feel, almost literally, breathless with trying to keep up. The shock/horror is constantly running in the background of my brain.
@wkamaubell I'm a loser who left the US 10 years ago. I voted for Hillary from here in November and went to the women's march here too!
@LaQuishaStR Hugs from down the hill.
The march politely waits at the crosswalk https://t.co/WT8MU7ruVr

I wonder what she would prefer the Senate committee ask? "Where did you get that jacket? Aren't ponies the best? Doâ€¦ https://t.co/3BKpD5PT8h
I feel like I'm on a 24-hour snap cycle and it is the worst and I can't make it stop. https://t.co/J0w0EqtOe7
I haven't been to a march since the big WTO one in Seattle in 1999 so I don't know from protesting.
Rather a different perspective on 'write the ACLU number on your arm.' Thoughts from people with protest experienceâ€¦ https://t.co/WE0iBETHOg

@EricBoehlert From your mouth to god's ears
Wellington buddies, please join me on Saturday! https://t.co/TWsGbs6VSM
@sallysimpleton Allday at work people kept popping their heads over the cube like 'are you SEEING this?' and I was like YES I AM SEEING IT.
People in NZ were actively congratulating me in January 2009--'America's come to its senses!' People called w/ condâ€¦ https://t.co/3avLQVefcS

@Little_Red_Boat @cruickshank @RVAwonk I keep waiting for someone to come and save us...for the grownups to arrive. There is no saving us.
Okay, so: who do I call, re: this Russia stuff? What is meant to happen next?
I don't want to live in the US again but being on the other side of the world while all this is happening is getting more and more stressful
Rest in peace, rest in power. 2017 not even a week old. https://t.co/CMcMiVTTDm
I know no one cares but...does no one care? https://t.co/E9VrZ617i1
In related news, I hate that one WINZ poster. https://t.co/UUC1HyKyr4
Thinking about my SW internship, finding DSM dx that would allow tx but not be too bad of a pre-existing. How I switched ins every year.
Thinking about friends and fam with chronic illness and disability.
Thinking about the other people in the cancer centre wsiting room, four years ago.
I'm sick to my stomach thinking about those people plotting to take health care away from sick people.
I enjoy (sort of, long story) universal health care in NZ and I am actively freaking out re: repealing ACA.
@mollykosm I maybe actually choked up at this.
@DrJenGunter I remember going through the DSM IV at internship trying to find dx that would allow tx but not = a pre-existing. Impossible.
I'll be there on the 21st at Parliament!
This is terrifyingly sound, practical, pragmatic advice. https://t.co/HV5p7t3PCF
I did this as a volunteer gig once. The echoes of my sobs as I had to leave my baby kangaroo! https://t.co/2dwN6Rott6
@tracyfood Nothing absurd about it, and I will not read the repliesðŸ˜˜
This calf's name is Myrtle, everybody. https://t.co/OPaQ13JobB
@duonJulie Yeah, mental disconnect is a good way to put it.
@duonJulie Also Presidents are about charisma, connection with people, etc, in a way Senators and Reps aren't, so it's a different feel.
@duonJulie Well, they do--the election cycle can be a bit different depending on the state, which sometimes means less media around it.
@LI_politico I've re-read every year since I was 15. This year's re-read was especially rough.
Floridians, how you holding up? https://t.co/oo2EgJJBg9
New Zealanders, if you want to call re: Aleppo tragedy : the US Embassy # is 09 303 2724 and the Russian is 04 476 6113. They open at 9:30.
@packsawallop I am going to see if my sister wants one for her school library (that she runs)--I think her kids would really like it.
@tracyfood @TeenVogue I heard a good suggestion today re: getting subscription for local school; I'll see if my sister's school wants one.
@Little_Red_Boat Just saw that! Encapsulates perfectly.
I can't keep up with the news--feel like I'm out of breath trying to run a marathon.
@sarahjeong I think about this pretty much every day. Also consider how useful various household goods might be re: barter.
@badtom Aaand there it is
The President is going to have...a side hustle??
@MeganWegan I also wonder that. I wonder how a lot of people are going to feel as the days and weeks and months go by.
@GaelFC I absolutely had that.

@tracyfood Literally just started it. I'm still thinking on it.

This has been...quite a week. Staying home today re: earthquake, checking supplies, and tweeting that I need to get off Twitter.
@amyherself Good call. Stay in touch xoxo
@amyherself You can come up to mine (in Mt Vic) whenever you want, girl. We got lots of food--will have to bring your own ice cream tho
Okay I definitely felt that aftershock
@johubris Yeah I have pants on now.
@amyherself @MsAnna_Jane Oh honey. Do you need me to come get you? I can come get you no problem and be to yours in fifteen minutes
@johubris Are you all right Jo?
We're okay, just very very awake. Apparently they felt it in Auckland.
Just had a really long scary earthquake. Centred near Hamner Springs. Is everyone okay?
@metiria I saw your comments re: not congratulating Trump, and as a terrified, heartbroken American woman in Wgtn: thank you so much.
@sophiebiblio I think I hate FB. (I know I hate Twitter, and yet here I am)
@amyherself I dread going in to work tomorrow.
@amyherself You're not joking, are you.
